info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:08PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
At 307 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Intersection Krome And U.S. 27, or near Pembroke Pines, moving southeast at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Davie, Sunrise, Miami Gardens, Weston, Doral, Miami Lakes, Cooper City, Hialeah Gardens, Medley, Royal Palm Ranches, Palm Springs North, Sunshine Acres, Intersection I-75 And Griffin Road, Country Club, Miramar Parkway And University Drive, and Pennsuco.
info.instruction:
These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Miami-Dade and southern Broward Counties through 345 PM EDT

area.areaDesc: Inland Broward County; Metro Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade
